intro: Croton jutiapensis, commonly known as the Jutiapa croton, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and striking, colorful flowers that range from yellow to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
